data.text: My comments above apply to synthetic bags, though the same method can be used for down. That said, I only use my down bag in cold weather, & also use a silk liner in it, so I rarely wash my down bag. data.text: Especially if down: Challenges are 1) getting all soap and water out and, especially 2) drying without much heat (and especially no hot spots in dryer) to leave no damp clumps which may mildew in less than a day. Hot spots in dryers can be a real problem even on low AVERAGE setting. Let the bag rest too long on one, as can happen if dryer shuts off mid heating cycle, and the nylon will scorch. You MUST pull the bag immediately after dryer stops. Problem with commercial laundry is that air-fluff with no or low heat may take expensive hours.
